channel.title: Angular on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Angular on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: Learn Angular Router for Real-World Applications
item.description: Finally, it's out!!! My Angular router course is now available on Egghead, go grab it :)

item.title: Better Redirects in Angular Route Guards
item.description: Angular version 7.1 not only comes with bugfixes but includes also a bunch of new features. In this post I’d like to particularly take a look at the optimizations added to route guards.

item.title: Article Design Demo
item.description: Demo article showcasing the various things you can use on this blog here

item.title: Egghead Lesson: Simple caching with RxJS
item.description: This is the accompanying article for my latest Egghead video lesson on caching data in Angular by leveraging RxjS. (adsbygoogle = window.

item.title: Egghead Lesson: Avoid memory leaks when subscribing to RxJS Observables in Angular Components
item.description: RxJS is a first class citizen in every Angular application. It's extremely powerful, but there are also some things you should know and be aware of when using it.

item.title: Simple State Management with RxJS’s scan operator
item.description: State management is a big topic currently in frontend development. For a reason: frontend frameworks/libraries got extremely powerful in the recent years, which led to more and more complex applications which need to be tamed.

item.title: My Journey replacing Promises with RxJS
item.description: In this post I’m going to tell you, step-by-step, how I used RxJS to refactor a method that was based on Promises. (adsbygoogle = window.

item.title: [object ErrorEvent] thrown by Karma in Angular Unit Tests
item.description: I’m pretty sure when you’ve already come across this exception: `[object ErrorEvent] thrown` when you execute your Karma tests in an Angular project. Not very helpful, right?

item.title: In-depth: How do CDK Portals work?
item.description: In the last article we were exploring how to leverage the Angular Material CDK portals for placing some piece of template from a component to some other location within our app.

item.title: Dynamic UI with CDK TemplatePortal and DomPortalHost
item.description: Ever wanted to place some piece of UI dynamically from one component to another? But the component that owns the content doesn't have any connection to the component that should display the content.

item.title: Extend the *ngIf Syntax to Create a Custom Permission Directive
item.description: So our use case is to create a directive, which shows/hides elements on the page based on our currently authenticated user's permissions. In this article we will go over a very simple use case, but which could easily be extended and used in a real production application.

item.title: Add Mocha reporter for Karma unit tests to your Angular CLI project
item.description: Every Angular CLI generated project comes already with a test setup in place using Karma. I think the default "progress" test result report is not as nice however.

item.title: Create a CD pipeline with Angular, GitLab and Firebase
item.description: I’m a huge fan of automating all the stuff. Even if you’re a very precise and organized person, you’re likely to make mistakes. Be it because you do multiple things at the same time, you get distracted wherever.

item.title: Create a ng-true-value & ng-false-value directive for Angular
item.description: If you come from AngularJS (v1.x) I'm pretty sure you remember the `ng-true-value` and `ng-false-value` directive you could hook onto the checkbox elements in your forms.

item.title: Compile-time vs. Runtime configuration of your Angular App
item.description: When you develop a bigger application, chances are quite high that you need some kind of configuration. That can range from simply visualizing the app's version number to injecting custom themes etc.

item.title: Three new Angular Courses to celebrate end of the Year 2017
item.description: 2017 has been AMAAAAZING (more in a later post..maybe). So before the year ends let's celebrate it with some new Angular courses. I've just released 3 of them last week on egghead.

item.title: Use Dynamic Components to render HTML for 3rd party libraries
item.description: Dynamic components in Angular are very powerful and help you solve the trickiest problems. In this example we're going to learn how we can leverage dynamic Angular components to render the HTML of a popup controlled by a Leaflet map.

item.title: Demystifying dynamic Forms in Angular
item.description: Heared about reactive Angular forms? Maybe even about dynamic forms? Never tried because you think it’s too complicated to setup and an overkill for your common use cases?

item.title: Understand How to Style Angular Components
item.description: Here it is!!! 🔥 🔥 🔥 My very first Egghead.io course 😃. Learn everything you need to know about styling Angular components. {% assign message = “Contents are based on Angular version >=2” %} {% include warn-notice.

item.title: Intercept HTTP Requests in Angular
item.description: Angular version 4.3.1 introduced one important new feature: the new HTTP client. Not only did it bring optimizations in how we can execute requests to backend APIs, but it made intercepting HTTP requests extremely easy.

item.title: Create a dynamic tab component with Angular
item.description: The purpose of this article is to learn about the concept of dynamic components and template references in Angular by building a dynamic tab component.

item.title: Enhanced *ngIf and *ngFor in Angular version 4.0.0
item.description: Ever wanted an "else" statement in *ngIf? It's finally here, together with some other nice improvements around dealing with Observables in templates. Let's explore them here.

item.title: Talks: Web meets Mobile powered by Angular
item.description: I had the pleasure to bring 3 amazing speakers on board for our Software Craftsmanship South Tyrol Meetup group which I'm organizing together with Christoph.

item.title: Tuning Angular's Change Detection
item.description: I recently prepared some course material for a modern web development workshop, which besides the nice features around ES6 obviously also included Angular. Change detection was part of that workshop and so I did some playing with it.

item.title: Angular Modules vs ES6 Modules
item.description: I often see people being confused when it comes to understanding Angular Modules vs. ES6 Modules. This happens especially for newcomers which enter the JavaScript and front-end development ecosystem and immediately get confronted with both of them.

item.title: Video Course: Learning Angular Components
item.description: I just released the 2nd edition of my video course for PacktPub on "Learning Angular components". {% assign message = “Contents are based on Angular version >=2” %} {% include warn-notice.

item.title: Talk: Testing with Angular - Some Recipes
item.description: I recently wanted to dive deeper into testing Angular applications, in specific on how to write proper unit tests for some common scenarious you might encounter.

item.title: NG-BE Conf and the Angular Community <3
item.description: I was lucky enough to be part of the Belgium's first Angular conference: NG-BE conf. It was by far the best conference I've attended so far!

item.title: Interviewing Igor Minar and Adam Bradley for AngularBeers
item.description: For the last meetup of 2016, AngularBeers organized an AMA session with Igor Minar (lead dev of Angular at Google) and Adam Bradley (lead dev of Ionic).

item.title: Ok.. let me explain: it's going to be Angular 4.0, or simply Angular
item.description: At the 8th and 9th of December 2016 was NG-BE, Belgium’s first Angular conference. Igor Minar (Angular lead dev) attended as the keynote speaker with some interesting announcements regarding Angular’s release schedule.

item.title: Configure Ahead of Time (AoT) for your Angular app using the Angular CLI
item.description: In our previous video we learned how to use the Angular CLI to create our first Angular application. Now it's time to prepare it for production.

item.title: Safe Navigation Operator, RxJS and Async Pipe tinkering
item.description: RxJS? Safe Navigation operator? Async pipes? Not sure what I'm talking about? In this article I'd like to explore some cool combination of Http, RxJS and Async Pipes.

item.title: Custom validators in template driven Angular forms
item.description: Angular version 2+ has two different kind of Forms API, the reactive and template driven approach. In this article we will focus on the template driven approach and learn how to use it as well as how to build a custom validator with it.

item.title: Data bind radio button lists with Angular
item.description: Assume you have a simple list or table of elements, each row having a radio button. The user can select one of the rows and your task is to determine the selected row entry.

item.title: Configure a proxy for your API calls with Angular CLI
item.description: In this article (video included!) we will learn how to setup your Angular development server and how to configure it to properly communicate with your backend (REST) API.

item.title: Let's create your first Angular app
item.description: Angular got released and so it's the perfect time to try it out. I totally understand it might be difficult to get started, but it doesn't have to.

item.title: Angular: Using the JSONPipe for debugging
item.description: A powerful way of debugging, especially templates, in Angular 1 was the JSON pipe (or filter) which could be used within a template. The pipe still natively exists in Angular.

item.title: Angular: How do I get a reference to the window object?
item.description: Remember the $window object in Angular 1? Turned out to be quite useful from now and then. But what about Angular? $window doesn't exist there.

item.title: Angular: How do I register an event listener on document?
item.description: I recently got asked by an Angular community member on Twitter how one can register an event on the document object. While it is totally possible to directly access the document object and hook up some listener, it is not suggested.

item.title: Angular version 2.0.0 released!!
item.description: It was at the ng-Europe, on the 22-23 September 2014 when the Angular team came with a huge surprise: "We're going to build Angular 2.

item.title: Angular Forms - a first look
item.description: Angular gets a brand new Forms API. It's fresh out of the compiler and since there's not much documentation around yet, @angular_zone powered by Gerard Sans and Wassim Chegham organized a Google Hangout with Kara Erickson, core contributor to the Forms Api.

item.title: RxJS first steps - Subject and ReplaySubject
item.description: I'm not sure you already heard about RxJS or Reactive Programming in general. There's currently a very strong movement towards such programming style in the modern JavaScript world, so you should definitely check it out.

item.title: Angular 2+ - A Getting Started Guide for Beginners
item.description: Since about half a year, I'm organizing a local Meetup group around Software Craftsmanship. I recently also published a video course on "Learning Angular 2 directives"

item.title: Learning Angular 2 Directives
item.description: Finally 😆, I managed to finish and publish my very first video course: "Learning Angular 2 Directives" by Packt Publishing. So relieved, and I even managed to publish it before the official RC1 😉.

item.title: Fine grained change detection with Angular
item.description: Today, while working on my Angular screencast series (announcement coming soon), I discovered a strange behavior when dealing with Angular change detection. Here's what I found.

item.title: Debugging Angular Applications from the Console
item.description: There have been some quite useful articles for how to debug Angular 1.x applications from the browser's console. But how can we achieve the same in Angular?

item.title: Learning Angular: Creating a tabs component
item.description: This is a follow-up article of thoughtram's excellent article on developing a tabs component with Angular, where we're going to explore an alternative way of creating a tab component by learning about @ContentChildren and AfterContentInit.

item.title: Learning Angular: Conditionally add styles to an element
item.description: Here we're going through a couple of ways to conditionally apply some styles to a DOM element in Angular. (adsbygoogle = window.

item.title: Multi Content Projection aka Multiple Transclusion
item.description: (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({}); If you’re an AngularJS developer, I’m sure you heard about transclusion. Sounds really weird and mysterious, at least that’s what I thought when I first heard it.

item.title: Upgrading Angular from 1.x
item.description: Yesterday the Angular team released Angular 2 in beta. With that, they also added an interesting step by step tutorial which guides you through upgrading an Angular 1.

item.title: Componentizing Workflow for Angular
item.description: (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({}); {% assign message = “Contents are based on Angular version >=2” %} {% include warn-notice.html %}

item.title: Use ngModelOptions to limit digest cycles
item.description: Some good hints on how to speed up your Angular app by limiting digest cycles.

item.title: Angular Connect London - Day 2
item.description: I’m lucky enough to be able to attend AngularConnect here in London. This article is my notebook from the sessions I attended on day 2.

item.title: Angular Connect London - Day 1
item.description: I’m lucky enough to be able to attend AngularConnect here in London. This article is going to be my notebook while attending the conference. Also take a look at my notes from day 2!

item.title: AngularJS: The Performance Parts
item.description: Todd Motto presents his insights on Angular performance issues and the advantages of upgrading from 1.2 to v1.4.

item.title: Easy testing with angular-spies
item.description: Small useful lib by Shai Reznik (@shai_reznik) that aims at helping you to test your Angular apps.

item.title: $q.defer: You're doing it wrong
item.description: Nice article on Angular deferreds, promises and things you may do wrong. use $q.when(['detail', 'simple']) for simple defereds use promise chaining whenever possible, like return $http.

item.title: Angular 2 survey results
item.description: Jeff Whelpley presents the results of a survey he conducted on Angular 2 among Angular developers. Some interesting insights and potential predictions for the future direction.

item.title: Angular 1 and Angular 2 integration: the path to seamless upgrade
item.description: Since when the Angular team at Google announced the release of Angular 2, a total rewrite of Angular v1, hot debates started around whether there’ll be a migration path.

item.title: Ultimate AngularJS and Ionic performance cheat sheet
item.description: Interesting article that lists many performance tips and tricks for Angular v1.x. $watch one-time binding track by use $log instead of console.log disable debug diagnostics -> $compileProvider.

item.title: @angularpodcast - Immutability with Angular with Minko Gechev
item.description: Immutability is something that is a hot topic recently. Although is has been used previously Facebook with React made it popular again (at least that’s my perception).

item.title: Host and Visibility in Angular 2's Dependency Injection
item.description: @PascalPrecht dives into the details of Angular 2’s dependency injection. Angular 2’s DI to solve all current issues more flexible; concept of host and child injectors Definition of a binding on a <video-player> component:
